answers.answer: WOW girlie!!!!!!!!! you are carrying a big girl!!! CONGRATULATIONS hunny!!!! you must be so proud of her!! =) Don't worry girl, I was fearful of the same... (im a big girl, and daddy is not small either) and doctor reassured me that he'll try to deliver her natural, but if he sees she's too big, he'll do C-section... which is not as bad as some people might think ;)I was a 10 pounder myself! so I think she's right on!So is she already in position?? with Maddie, the last time we meassured her (27weeks) she was still breach!!! =S so we'll have to see how that goes!=)

I did not have measurements taken before my 1st and 2nd babies were born, but they were 9.4 and 10.5 pounds, both 21 inches long. I did have c-sections with them both because neither would drop into the birth canal. The c-sections went fine because they were not rushed or emergency.I love big babies because they are strong and healthy and when they lose a little weight during those first few days, they started out with plenty to spare. There is the challenge of clothing though because baby clothing manufacturers tend to use the 50 percentile growth chart for sizing and my babies were always 95% or above so were usually in the size or two bigger than their age. They both grew out of the infant car seat within 4-5 months too!  Best wishes!!!!

Hey girls!  Thanks for the feedback.  The baby is in the right position.  She was head down, facing my butt.  How nice.  =)  If she has to be delivered by c-section, I'm ok with.  I'll do what I have to do. I thought about the clothing thing too.  I know that she'll probably be over 8lbs which will put her out of newborn clothing.  A friend of mine gave me a lot of stuff from when her daughter was born.  Much of it is preemie, yeah, that's not going to work.  We'll see how it goes.  Overall, I'm ok, as long as there will be no ill effects toward her.  =)
did you have the gestational diabetes test?  even if you passed I would say limit your sugar just in case...
I did have the diabetes test but everything was good.  I will be limiting the sugar though.  I have an appointment with my dr. this afternoon and hopefully, he'll have some insight for me.

Well I cannot say I have ever been in this posiion before now, as all my babies were born early and the biggest was 6lbs10oz., well I went for an appt. on Tuesday and the doctor said she neded to order an US b/c this was a big baby. I was floored to say the least. She said we would need to make a plan since it was doubtful with my history that I would be able to vaginally have a baby much bigger than 7 lbs. I have to say I don't want a c-section b/c of the recovery period. I am going to be at home with my 2yr old and a new baby so I hope not to have the added recovery time. (don't want to spend my vacation money on a baby nurse lol). Well I know I didn't help you with your question but I am just a bit worried and maybe you can put a plan together with your doctor as well. Good Luck!! Sheri 35 wks 2days

question: So I had my 35 week u/s to check the baby's position, weight, and amniotic fluid levels.  They are estimating that the baby weighs 7.6lbs.  Doesn't that seem a bit high?  She's supposed to gain 1/2 lbs per week until birth.  That's four weeks away, give or take a few days.  I asked the sonographer how accurate these measurements are and she said that the baby was in a great position for measuring.  Her belly and head were perfect so she doesn't think the weight is off by much.  I'm a little worried that the baby will be too big.  I haven't gained an excessive amount of weight.  What do you all think?  Has anyone had large measurements at 35 weeks and ended up with a huge baby?  Just wondering.  As long as she's healthy, I'm cool with it.  I just want to be prepared.  Thanks for any advice you have!
title: 7.6lbs baby at 35 week u/s?
